maml:description.maml:para: Adds content to a file in Data Lake Store.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreContent cmdlet adds content to a file in Data Lake Store file.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add content to a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds the content specified by the Value parameter to the file myFile.txt.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a file from Data Lake Store.
The Export-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet downloads a file from Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Download an item from the Data Lake Store

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command downloads the file TestSource.csv from the Data Lake Store to C:\Test.csv.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets details of a Data Lake Store account.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet gets details of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.
Specifies the name of the account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to get.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get a Data Lake Store account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the account named ContosoADL.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of items in a folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreChildItem cmdlet gets the list of items in a folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the folder, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the child items for a folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the child items for the MyFiles folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl cmdlet gets the access control list (ACL) of a filer or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the ACL for a folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the ACL for the root directory of the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the contents of a file in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemContent cmdlet gets the contents of a file in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of a file, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the number of bytes to skip in a file before getting content.
Specifies the length, in bytes, of the content to get.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the length, in bytes, of the content to get.
Specifies the number of bytes to skip in a file before getting content.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of a file, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the contents of a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the contents of the file MyFile.txt in the ContosoADL account.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemOwner cmdlet gets the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of an item, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to get. Valid values are: User, Group.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of an item, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to get. Valid values are: User, Group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the owner for a directory

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the user owner for the root directory of the ContosoADL account.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet gets the details of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path from which to get details of an item, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path from which to get details of an item, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get details of a file from the Data Lake Store

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the details of the file Test.csv from the Data Lake Store.

maml:description.maml:para: Uploads a file to Data Lake Store.
The Import-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet uploads a file to Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the local path of the file or folder to upload.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation should upload all items in all subfolders.
Indicates that this operation should resume a previously canceled or failed upload.
Indicates that this operation uploads the file as a binary file.
Specifies the number of threads to use to upload the file or folder.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Indicates that this operation uploads the file as a binary file.
Specifies the number of threads to use to upload the file or folder.
Specifies the local path of the file or folder to upload.
Indicates that this operation should upload all items in all subfolders.
Indicates that this operation should resume a previously canceled or failed upload.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Upload a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uploads the file SrcFile.csv and adds it to the MyFiles folder in the Data Lake Store as File.csv.

maml:description.maml:para: Joins one or more files to create one file in Data Lake Store.
The Join-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet joins one or more files to create one file in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an array of Data Lake Store paths of the files to combine, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the Data Lake Store path for the joined item, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path for the joined item, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies an array of Data Lake Store paths of the files to combine, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Join two items

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command joins File01.txt and File02.txt to create the file CombinedFile.txt.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves or renames a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Move-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet moves or renames a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to move or rename, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to move the item, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to move the item, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to move or rename, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Move and rename an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames the item File.txt to RenamedFile.txt and moves it to a different folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Data Lake Store account.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet creates a new Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account.
Specifies the name of the account to create.

Specifies the location to use for the account. Valid values are:
-- East US 2
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory group to use as the default group owner for new files and folders.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory group to use as the default group owner for new files and folders.

Specifies the location to use for the account. Valid values are:
-- East US 2
Specifies the name of the account to create.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Data Lake Store account named ContosoADL for the East US 2 location.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The New-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet creates a new file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to create, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item you create.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Indicates that this operation creates a folder.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination item if it already exists.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the encoding for the item to create. Valid values are:
-- Unknown -- String -- Unicode -- Byte -- BigEndianUnicode -- UTF8 -- UTF7 -- Ascii -- Default -- Oem -- BigEndianUTF32
Indicates that this operation creates a folder.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination item if it already exists.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to create, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item you create.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a new file and a new folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates the file NewFile.txt for the specified account.
The second command creates the folder NewFolder at the root folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a Data Lake Store account permanently.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet deletes a Data Lake Store account permanently.
Specifies the name of the account to remove.
Specifies the resource group that contains the account to remove.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the account to remove.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the resource group that contains the account to remove.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a Data Lake Store account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the account named ContosoADL from the Data Lake Store.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an entry (ACE) from the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry cmdlet removes an entry (ACE) from the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item from which to remove an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the access control list (ACL) object that contains the entries to be removed.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item from which to remove an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the type of ACE to remove. Valid values are:
-- User -- Group -- Mask -- Other
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal for which to remove an ACE.
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACE from the specified ACL.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the type of ACE to remove. Valid values are:
-- User -- Group -- Mask -- Other
Specifies the access control list (ACL) object that contains the entries to be removed.
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACE from the specified ACL.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal for which to remove an ACE.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item from which to remove an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a user entry

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the user ACE for Patti Fuller from the ContosoADL account.

maml:description.maml:para: Clears the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl cmdlet clears the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACL for a file or a folder.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACL for a file or a folder.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove the ACL from a folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the ACL for the root directory for the ContosoADL account.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet deletes a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an array of Data Lake Store paths of the files to remove, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation deletes all items in the target folder, including subfolders. Unless you specify the Clean parameter, the target folder is also deleted.
Indicates that this operation removes all of the contents of the target folder and retains the folder. Use this parameter with the Recurse parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Indicates that this operation removes all of the contents of the target folder and retains the folder. Use this parameter with the Recurse parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of Data Lake Store paths of the files to remove, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation deletes all items in the target folder, including subfolders. Unless you specify the Clean parameter, the target folder is also deleted.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove multiple items

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the files File01.txt and File.csv from the Data Lake Store.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a Data Lake Store account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet modifies a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the ID of an Azure Active Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Specifies the ID of an Azure Active Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a tag to an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds the specified tag to the Data Lake Store account named ContosoADL.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an entry (ACE) in the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry cmdlet modifies an entry (ACE) in the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item for which to modify an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the type of ACE to modify. Valid values are:
-- User -- Group -- Mask -- Other
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal for which to modify an access control entry (ACE).
Indicates that this operation modifies the default ACE from the specified ACL.

Specifies the permissions for the ACE. Valid values are:
-- None -- Execute -- Write -- WriteExecute -- Read -- ReadExecute -- ReadWrite -- All
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item for which to modify an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the ACL object that contains the entries to modify.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the type of ACE to modify. Valid values are:
-- User -- Group -- Mask -- Other
Specifies the ACL object that contains the entries to modify.
Indicates that this operation modifies the default ACE from the specified ACL.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal for which to modify an access control entry (ACE).
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item for which to modify an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the permissions for the ACE. Valid values are:
-- None -- Execute -- Write -- WriteExecute -- Read -- ReadExecute -- ReadWrite -- All

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Modify permissions for an ACE

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command modifies the ACE for Patti Fuller to have all permissions.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl cmdlet modifies the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the ACL for a file and a folder
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ACL = Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path / PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" â€“Path /MyFiles/Test.txt â€“Acl $ACL

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ACL for the root directory of the ContosoADL account, and then stores it in the $ACL variable.
The second command sets the ACL for the file Test.txt to the one in $ACL.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDDataLakeStoreItemOwner cmdlet modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. Valid values are: User, Group.
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the object ID of the Azure Active Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. Valid values are: User, Group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the owner for an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the owner for the root directory to Patti Fuller.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the account named ContosoADL exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the type of item to test. Valid values are:
-- Any -- File -- Folder
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).

Specifies the type of item to test. Valid values are:
-- Any -- File -- Folder

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the file Test.csv exists in the ContosoADL account.
